item.title: Justine add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Justine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Justine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Justine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Justine add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Justine add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Justine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Justine add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Justine add a quote by Emerson, Ralph Waldo
item.description: "I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me." -- Emerson, Ralph Waldo

item.title: Justine add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Despite the enormous quantity of books, how few people read! And if one reads profitably, one would realize how much stupid stuff the vulgar herd is content to swallow every day." -- Voltaire

item.title: Justine add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "We read books to find out who we are. What other people, real or imaginary, do and think and feel... is an essential guide to our understanding of what we ourselves are and may become." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Justine add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Justine add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Reading good books ruins you for enjoying bad books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Justine add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Don't join the book burners. Don't think you're going to conceal faults by concealing evidence that they ever existed. Don't be afraid to go in your library and read every book..." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Justine add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity and once more in old age, as a fine building should be seen by morning light, at noon and by moonlight." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Justine add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?" -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Justine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Justine add a quote by Anne Herbert
item.description: "Libraries will get you through times of no money better than money will get you through times of no libraries." -- Anne Herbert

item.title: Justine add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "If all printers were determined not to print anything till they were sure it would offend nobody, there would be very little printed." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Justine add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "[I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Justine add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound and stab us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Justine add a quote by Peter S. Jennison
item.description: "Children deprived of words become school dropouts; dropouts deprived of hope behave delinquently. Amateur censors blame delinquency on reading immoral books and magazines, when in fact, the inability to read anything is the basic trouble." -- Peter S. Jennison

item.title: Justine add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "One glance at a book and you hear the voice of another person, perhaps someone dead for 1,000 years. To read is to voyage through time." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Justine add a quote by James Russell Lowell
item.description: "Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind." -- James Russell Lowell

item.title: Justine add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "It wasn't until I started reading and found books they wouldn't let us read in school that I discovered you could be insane and happy and have a good life without being like everybody else." -- John Waters

item.title: Justine add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description:
"Censorship ends in logical completeness when nobody is allowed to read any books except the books that nobody <i>can</i> read."
[As quoted in <i>Literary Censorship in England</i> (in <i>Current Opinion</i>, Vol. 55, No. 5, November 1913)]" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Justine add a quote by Mason Cooley
item.description: "Reading gives us someplace to go when we have to stay where we are." -- Mason Cooley

item.title: Justine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Never read a book that is not a year old." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Justine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Justine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde
